docs.abstract: The musician and TV creator’s new project, a 55-minute film with Rihanna, is available now to stream on Amazon.
docs.snippet: The musician and TV creator’s new project, a 55-minute film with Rihanna, is available now to stream on Amazon.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Guava Island,” a new 55-minute film starring Donald Glover and Rihanna, was released as a limited-time free stream on Amazon overnight Saturday, during Glover’s headlining set as Childish Gambino at the Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival.

headline.main: Donald Glover’s ‘Guava Island’ Debuts After Coachella Set as Childish Gambino

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival

docs.abstract: My dad was a longtime labor activist. He despises what Jeff Bezos built, but he can’t quit it.
docs.snippet: My dad was a longtime labor activist. He despises what Jeff Bezos built, but he can’t quit it.
docs.lead_paragraph: Sharing an Amazon Prime account with loved ones is surprisingly intimate. You’re privy to one another’s impulse buys, fondness for corny ’90s comedies and preferred brands of vaginal suppositories. Like many families, mine shares a login for the ubiquitous delivery behemoth. Every time my dad or my sister orders an item, I see a cheerful red badge pop up on my app: “Your Amazon.com shipment is on its way!”

headline.main: Hate Amazon? Try Living Without It
headline.print_headline: Hate Amazon? Try Living Without It

docs.abstract: A British mini-series on Amazon Prime Video centers on a son of Pakistani immigrants whose wit, charm and courage make him a superior snitch.
docs.snippet: A British mini-series on Amazon Prime Video centers on a son of Pakistani immigrants whose wit, charm and courage make him a superior snitch.
docs.lead_paragraph: As the television reports a terrorist attack on the continent, Raza Shar, the British-born son of Pakistani immigrants, prepares to go out for a night on the town in London. “Anyone picks on you, don’t be brave,” his father admonishes him. “Tell him you’re a Hindu.” Raza rolls his eyes, nods and recites, “Don’t freak, I’m a Sikh.”

headline.main: Review: ‘Informer’ Finds a Fresh Take on the Terrorism Thriller
headline.print_headline: Fresh Take on the Terrorism Thriller

docs.abstract: Even as Facebook, Google and others confronted challenges in 2018, their ambitions were undimmed. After all, so much of life remains undisrupted.
docs.snippet: Even as Facebook, Google and others confronted challenges in 2018, their ambitions were undimmed. After all, so much of life remains undisrupted.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif. — Silicon Valley ended 2018 somewhere it had never been: embattled.

headline.main: Big Tech May Look Troubled, but It’s Just Getting Started
headline.print_headline: Did Troubles Clip Wings Of Big Tech? Not Just Yet

docs.abstract: A years-long battle over control of the domain name, which included promises of free Kindles, may soon be decided.
docs.snippet: A years-long battle over control of the domain name, which included promises of free Kindles, may soon be decided.
docs.lead_paragraph: SÃO PAULO, Brazil — Amazon is the world’s biggest online retailer. It is also the world’s largest rain forest.

headline.main: Battle for .amazon Domain Pits Retailer Against South American Nations
headline.print_headline: Tech Giant and South American Nations Clash Over Right to a Web Domain

docs.abstract: The retail behemoth is laying the groundwork to penetrate Brazil’s huge consumer market, analysts say. Success won’t come easy.
docs.snippet: The retail behemoth is laying the groundwork to penetrate Brazil’s huge consumer market, analysts say. Success won’t come easy.
docs.lead_paragraph: SÃO PAULO, Brazil — Its market value briefly surpassed $1 trillion. It has transformed online shopping. And it has had North American cities holding out billions to deliver its new outposts to their doors.

headline.main: Amazon Sees in Brazil Continent-Size Profits and Problems
headline.print_headline: Amazon Sees in Brazil Continent-Size Profits, And Challenges as Big

docs.abstract: Mayor de Blasio’s progressive allies have lashed out at the heavy subsidies for Amazon’s move to Queens.
docs.snippet: Mayor de Blasio’s progressive allies have lashed out at the heavy subsidies for Amazon’s move to Queens.

headline.main: Can New York City’s Mayor Be an Amazon Booster and Still Be Progressive?
headline.print_headline: How the Amazon Deal Shows de Blasio to Be a Progressive Paradox

byline.original: By J. David Goodman and William Neuman

docs.abstract: Apps can replace a paper-money allowance for children, encouraging them not only to do their chores but also to save and spend their money carefully.
docs.snippet: Apps can replace a paper-money allowance for children, encouraging them not only to do their chores but also to save and spend their money carefully.
docs.lead_paragraph: Jonathan and Erin Kraftchick started out by paying their two children’s allowance the old-fashioned way, using paper money.

headline.main: How Parents Teach Smart Spending With Apps, Not Cash

docs.abstract: People are increasingly calling for boycotts of the big tech companies amid a backlash. The problem is that Facebook, Apple, Amazon and Google are nearly inescapable.
docs.snippet: People are increasingly calling for boycotts of the big tech companies amid a backlash. The problem is that Facebook, Apple, Amazon and Google are nearly inescapable.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Ryan Knight, a Democratic activist in Los Angeles, called for a boycott of Apple in February because it hadn’t responded to calls to delete a channel from the National Rifle Association from its streaming-video service after the Parkland, Fla., school shooting.

headline.main: They Tried to Boycott Facebook, Apple and Google. They Failed.

docs.abstract: Amazon announced more than a dozen devices and tools for its Alexa voice assistant, including a microwave.
docs.snippet: Amazon announced more than a dozen devices and tools for its Alexa voice assistant, including a microwave.
docs.lead_paragraph: SEATTLE — If you’re one of the millions of people without a smart speaker in your home, Amazon wants to talk to you.

headline.main: Hey, Alexa, Why is Amazon Making a Microwave?
